titleStmt.title: The mournful mite, or, The true subject's sigh on the death of the illustrious and serene Charles II, King of Great-Britain, France, and Ireland, &c. by Peter Ker.
titleStmt.author: Ker, Patrick, fl. 1691.

notesStmt.note: Wing attributes to Peter Ker; however, evidence indicates that Patrick Ker, who wrote "The mournful elegy" in 1685 about the death of Charles II, is the author. This attribution is verified by Houghton Library, Harvard University.
Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
